name: GRS.PCa.451

publication.title: Characterizing prostate cancer risk through multi-ancestry genome-wide discovery of 187 novel risk variants

samples_variants.ancestry_broad: European, African unspecified, East Asian, Hispanic or Latin American
samples_variants.ancestry_additional: European, African, East Asian, and Hispanic populations

trait_efo.label: prostate carcinoma
trait_efo.description: A carcinoma that arises from epithelial cells of the prostate gland.

method_name: Independent genome-wide significant variants included, identified from fine-mapping GWAS results.
method_params: Variants/weights used were from multi-ancestry GWAS meta-analysis, with fine-mapping performed using mJAM (multi-ancestry Joint Analysis of Marginal summary statistics) to obtain conditional betas within each population.
license: PGS obtained from the Catalog should be cited appropriately, and used in accordance with any licensing restrictions set by the authors. See EBI Terms of Use (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/about/terms-of-use/) for additional details.

name: GRS.PCa.451.TOPMed

publication.title: Characterizing prostate cancer risk through multi-ancestry genome-wide discovery of 187 novel risk variants

samples_variants.ancestry_broad: European, African unspecified, East Asian, Hispanic or Latin American
samples_variants.ancestry_additional: European, African, East Asian, and Hispanic populations

trait_efo.label: prostate carcinoma
trait_efo.description: A carcinoma that arises from epithelial cells of the prostate gland.

method_name: Independent genome-wide significant variants included, identified from fine-mapping GWAS results. Variants were lifted-over from GRCh37 to GRCh38, proxy variants in TOPMED imputation panel were selected if no exact variant was available in TOPMed.
method_params: Variants/weights used were from multi-ancestry GWAS meta-analysis, with fine-mapping performed using mJAM (multi-ancestry Joint Analysis of Marginal summary statistics) to obtain conditional betas within each population.
license: PGS obtained from the Catalog should be cited appropriately, and used in accordance with any licensing restrictions set by the authors. See EBI Terms of Use (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/about/terms-of-use/) for additional details.
